WHY THE AI CAPEX BOOM IS JUST BEGINNING

I believe there are two verticals still wildly misunderstood: cloud infrastructure and the AI deployment layer. Everyoneâ€™s trying to call the top -- but what if weâ€™re nowhere near it?

The bear case goes like this: hyperscaler growth will taper, AI capex will fade, and cloud is â€œmaturing.â€ But hereâ€™s the truth -- 85% of global IT spend is still on-prem. And yet $AMZN AWS just did $123B, $MSFT Azure $75B, and $GOOGL Cloud $49B over the past year. Thatâ€™s not saturation -- thatâ€™s the early innings of migration.

And this isnâ€™t just about training LLMs. Itâ€™s about every enterprise app going AI-native. Every workflow, every vertical, every user interface will need low-latency inference, secure data pipelines, and orchestration layers that simply donâ€™t run on legacy infrastructure. It runs in the cloud -- and it runs on clouds built for AI.

So no, I donâ€™t buy the â€œcapex cliffâ€ story. Not when weâ€™re staring at a $2T+ cloud market thatâ€™s still mostly untapped. Not when enterprises are just beginning to fine-tune models and deploy agents into production. And not when new AI-native workloads are being born every quarter.
ï¿¼
The cloud is the foundation of the AI economy. And weâ€™re only getting started.
